level.heading: INSTITUTION OF A CHARGE AND FORMAL HEARING (§ 3-3706)

level.text: Upon belief that sufficient evidence exists constituting an apparent violation of the Act and/or of Chapters 30-41 of this title, the Director shall institute a formal charge or complaint against the alleged violator pursuant to Chapter 4 of this title.
The basis for the Director’s jurisdiction over the alleged violation(s);
A recitation of the facts alleged to be violations of the Act and/or regulations;
The Director shall present evidence of the violation to the Board in an adversarial and open hearing.
